intro: Lellingeria oreophila, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, which helps reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lellingeria oreophila is considered a species of conservation concern.
